title: Chapter 7, Eviction, and Default Judgement
question: Hello,
answers:
Pre-Petition debt discharged in your BK.
If you abandoned lease and vacated prior to filing BK you are not liable for any rent.
If you vacated after filing BK, you may be liable for that period rent.
Co-tenant not relieved of rent obligation by your BK.

Your situation is not uncommon when people think that they cannot afford an attorney and try to handle legal matters pro se. In reality, most people in your situation cannot afford to proceed without an attorney.

It may not be too late. An experienced bankruptcy attorney may be able to reopen you chapter 7 and file an adversary proceeding against the landlord for violation of the the automatic stay if the lifting of the stay was for specific issues and the landlord exceeded what he was authorized to do in the lift stay order. There is no way for the attorneys on this forum to know all the facts and be able to advise you.

At this point, you really need to take the time to meet with an experienced bankruptcy attorney that handles chapter 7 and chapter 13 cases. Most bankruptcy attorneys will meet with you at no charge for the initial appointment. You can use the Avvo "Find a Lawyer" link at the top of this page to search for an attorney.

Your timing and dates are a little fuzzy but any pre petition rent should be discharged in the bankruptcy. Did you indicate that you were forfeiting the lease in your bankruptcy petition? You may owe post petition rent if you didn't vacate prior to filing the bankruptcy petition. If your co-tenant signed the lease along with you, then the co-tenant has "joint and several" liability for the entire amount of back rent owed, not just half.

More information is needed to give you useful advice: If the debt for unpaid rent existed at the time of filing your BK, it is dischargeable in full. It doesn't matter what the amount you listed in your Schedule F. If you didn't list it, you can amend it and also, notify the Superior Court of your filing so they won't issue any enforcement documents (writ/abstract). You need to file a Notice of Stay of Proceedings (Judicial Council Form CM-180). If the judgment was obtained prior to the LL motion to lift the stay, it is void and must be vacated by the Superior Court.

A breach of lease is typically a dischargeable debt, even if a judgment has been entered.. The fact that the landlord obtained relief from stay does not change that.

If the landlord attempts to collect the debt from you personally you may have to ask the court to intervene. Check the local court rules for guidance on contempt sanctions.
